parent_formation: No. 252 Wing, Air Headquarters Egypt, RAF Middle East
assigned_to_ground: Air defence of Suez Canal and Nile Delta

commander.name: P.B. Pitcher
commander.notes: Commanded 28 March - 17 November 1942, covering most of Q4 1942. Repatriated to Canada mid-November.

base: Idku, Egypt (10 October 1942 - 24 January 1943); Shandur (5 September - 9 October 1942); Detachments to Cairo, Heliopolis, Al Kufra Oasis, Cyprus, Benghazi

variants.notes: Primary equipment September-November 1942. Specifications: Rolls-Royce Merlin XX 1,280-1,300hp, 538kph/334mph max speed, 35,600ft ceiling, 4x20mm Hispano Mk II cannons (364 rounds total), 2x250lb or 2x500lb bombs or 8x3in rockets, Vokes tropical filter. Known serials: HL891 (F/S Leguerrier first victory 26 Sep 1942)

Arrived November 1942, full conversion by mid-January 1943. Specifications: Rolls-Royce Merlin 45/46 1,470hp, 601kph/374mph max speed, 37,000ft ceiling, 470mi range, universal wing (4x20mm Hispano OR 2x20mm + 4x.303in Browning), 2x250lb bombs, Vokes or Aboukir tropical filter

operations_history.operation: First operational mission in Middle East
operations_history.notes: 2x Hurricane IIB patrol over Suez at 25,000 ft from Shandur
F/S J.H.G. Leguerrier in Hurricane IIC HL891 destroyed Ju.88 at 28,000 ft SE of Suez - squadron's first victory

operations_history.operation: Second Battle of El Alamein (defensive patrol)
operations_history.notes: Canal Zone defence during El Alamein offensive
WO W.K. Grant killed in flying accident early November

operations_history.operation: Port Said to Alexandria convoy protection
operations_history.notes: Ju.88 damaged in engagement during convoy patrol

sources: RCAF Association - 417 Squadron (S/L P.B. Pitcher command 28 Mar - 17 Nov 1942, bases: Shandur 5 Sep-9 Oct, Idku 10 Oct-24 Jan 1943, aircraft: Hurricane IIB/IIC then Spitfire VB/VC Sep 1942, first mission 13 Sep 1942, first victory 26 Sep 1942)

Asisbiz.com - RCAF No 417Sqn 'City of Windsor' Squadron (operational timeline, first mission 13 Sep 1942, Hurricane IIC equipment, Spitfire arrival, first victory 26 Sep 1942 F/S Leguerrier/HL891, 800+ sorties from Idku)
History of War - No. 417 Squadron RCAF (Hurricane IIB/IIC September 1942, Spitfire VB and VC November 1942, No. 252 Wing assignment 27 Oct 1942, Idku primary base Oct 1942-Jan 1943)
Smithsonian National Air and Space Museum - Hurricane Mk IIC (specifications: 4x20mm Hispano, Merlin XX 1,280-1,300hp, 538 kph/334mph, 35,600ft ceiling, 2,624kg empty/3,951kg gross, 12.2m span)
Wikipedia - Supermarine Spitfire variants specifications (Spitfire Vc: Merlin 45/46 1,470hp, 374mph at 13,000ft, 37,000ft ceiling, 470mi range, universal wing 4x20mm or 2x20mm+4x.303)
Web search - Spitfire tropical filters (Vokes filter and Aboukir filter developed at RAF Aboukir Egypt August 1942 for desert operations)
Web search - Hurricane IIC specifications (armament: 4x20mm Hispano 364 rounds total, rate of fire 600-650 rpm, tropical Vokes filter configuration)
metadata.notes: COMBAT SUMMARY (Q4 1942): ~200+ sorties October-December, 2 claims (1 Ju.88 destroyed, 1 damaged), 1 loss (flying accident). Squadron flew 800+ total sorties from Idku through January 1943. Minimal enemy contact - only twice were enemy aircraft encountered in Q4 1942. PRIMARY ROLE: Defensive patrol of Suez Canal and Nile Delta rather than front-line combat. UNIT HISTORY: Only Canadian squadron in Desert Air Force. Formed Charmy Down England 27 Nov 1941, known as 'City of Windsor' (adopted May 1943). Deployed Egypt April-June 1942 but no aircraft until midsummer. Re-assembled with Hurricanes 5 Sep 1942 at Shandur. Squadron fully converted to Spitfire Vc by mid-January 1943, then moved west to join Eighth Army in Tunisia for offensive operations (February 1943). SOURCE VALIDATION: Tier 1 sources (10 facts): Smithsonian Hurricane IIC specs. Tier 2 sources (32 facts): RCAF Association (commander, bases, dates), Asisbiz (operations, victories), History of War (aircraft, wing assignment). Wikipedia (20 facts): unit designation, formation, Spitfire specs, general overview. Tier 1/2 percentage: 68%. RESEARCH GAPS: Christopher Shores volumes not accessible, RCAF ORBs not accessed, precise aircraft serials (only HL891 confirmed), flight commander names, detailed pilot roster, exact Hurricane-to-Spitfire transition timeline, ground crew breakdown by trade, detailed casualty list beyond WO Grant, precise monthly sortie counts, WITW cross-reference, Nafziger Collection docs, Canadian military archives war diary, successor commander after S/L Pitcher (17 Nov onward).
